intro: Canthium tavoyanum var. glabrius, commonly known as the smooth canthium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stem and alternate, ovate leaves that are usually smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of yellow or white. Its fruit is a capsule that dehisces to release small, dry seeds. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
